param.name: enginePath
param.dialogReference: The file specified here should be the full path to the "taskengine.exe" file located in the ENVI installation.
param.pythonReference: The file specified here should be the full path to the "taskengine.exe" file located in the ENVI installation.

param.name: compileMode
param.dialogReference: If set to "True", the Engine will be run in compile mode. Note: your ENVI license must include this feature.
param.pythonReference: If set to "True", the Engine will be run in compile mode. Note: your ENVI license must include this feature.

param.dialogReference: Set this to True if you wish to specify a custom ENVI library path.
param.pythonReference: Set this to True if you wish to specify a custom ENVI library path.

param.dialogReference: This is the path describing the path to a directory, or directories, that contain your custom ENVI code. If you are specifying multiple directory paths, they must be separated by a semicolon.
param.pythonReference: This is the path describing the path to a directory, or directories, that contain your custom ENVI code. If you are specifying multiple directory paths, they must be separated by a semicolon.

tool.summary: Use this tool to configure the ENVI Engine to run ENVI Tasks wrapped as GPTools.
tool.usage:
In order to execute ENVI Tasks from an ArcGIS Toolbox, it is necessary to configure the ENVI Engine so that the ArcMap or ArcGIS Pro can properly run ENVI.

The only required parameter is the Engine Location, which must point to the "taskengine.exe" in your ENVI distribution.

You may choose to run the ENVI engine in "compile" mode, which instructs the ENVI engine to compile ENVI source files (".pro" code). By default, the Engine requires ".sav" files. In order to run the Engine in "compile" mode, you must posses a license that allows the Engine to compile source code files.

You may also choose to specify a directory that contains ENVI code that is associated with the ENVI Tasks you are running. This would be a directory outside of your ENVI installation that contains the ".pro" or ".sav" files that are required for your tools to run.
